# SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample.NoiseTerms

**Structure**

The mathematical terms that you use to compute the photoplethysmogram (PPG) noise.

## Declaration

```swift
struct NoiseTerms
```

## Overview

To estimate the total ambient noise, subtract the scaled background noise offset ([doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample/NoiseTerms-swift.struct/backgroundNoiseOffset]) from the background noise ([doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample/backgroundNoise]). Compute the scaling factor (normalized noise equivalent bandwidth) based on your digital filter setup.

## Accessing noise terms

- **whiteNoise**: An estimate of the white noise of the sensor.
- **pinkNoise**: An estimate of the pink noise of the sensor.
- **backgroundNoise**: An estimate of the ambient noise intrusion of the sensor.
- **backgroundNoiseOffset**: An estimate of the electronics noise floor level of the sensor.

## Accessing optical data

- **emitter**: The index of the LED in use during the sample.
- **activePhotodiodeIndexes**: The set of photodiodes in use during the sample.
- **signalIdentifier**: The identifier for a signal that photodiodes and emitters produce.
- **nominalWavelength**: The wavelength in nanometers that the emitter produces while operating at a specific temperature.
- **effectiveWavelength**: A temperature-compensated wavelength estimate in nanometers that the emitter produces.
- **samplingFrequency**: The sampling frequency of the photoplethysmogram (PPG) data in hertz.
- **nanosecondsSinceStart**: The time in nanoseconds since the system turns on the sensor.
- **conditions**: The sensor context or conditions that may affect the sample.
- **SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample.Condition**: The conditions that may occur when recording photoplethysmogram optical data.
- **noiseTerms**: The mathematical terms for computing the noise in this sample.
- **normalizedReflectance**: The normalized photoplethysmogram (PPG) waveform.
